** The stars over head were indeed beautiful, but he also remembered just 
how lonely and isolated it was up where they were.
He remembered the vastness of the dark and the endless silence, when there 
was nothing except the occasional passage of a planet of galaxy.
And as he remembered, the stars seemed to grow dimmer and lose their 
brilliance.
Dinobot let out a wistful sigh as he lowered his snout from the skies and 
peered down at his transmetal claws lying before him, not really seeing 
them. Remembering she shining place that he was really destined to be, the 
Matrix.
The more he remembered about his journey to the Matrix the more he realized 
something, important.
Which he unconsciously spoke out loud�**

� Life is not appreciated until one no longer has it��

** But even his metallic lips moved to the words, the real impact was within 
himself.
It was all a lie. For him, once he had had it, he didn�t want to go back.
His previous life still haunted him, and locked him in the same attitude and 
ways he remembered before.
Nothing had changed about him, other then his appearance.
Dinobot had at least thought that it would be different this time, that his 
spark wouldn�t be locked in the same shard of ice as before.
That he might be able to have a proper sense of life, learn to have fun like 
everyone else, maybe even learn to love.
But NO!
He was the same sparkless slag as he was before, and nothing, NOTHING had 
changed.
Dinobot slammed his, now balled, fists into the scales of Necroamncer, his 
eyes clenched shut in utter disappointment, shame and hate.
He wasn�t supposed to be here, not alive and breathing! He was supposed to 
be in the Matrix, nothing more then a lost memory in this world. A story 
told to others when asked, just a tale.
But NO!
He had been cheated! Tricked into believing that there was something beyond 
this life, into believing that there really was a place for honored warriors 
like he was to finally rest and disappear into oblivion.
His deed of saving the humans was worth THIS?!
Leaving to journey to the Matrix, only to be forced back and to live again?!
It wasn�t fair, it wasn�t right!
Dinobot suddenly got to his feet in one abrupt movement, bit head snapping 
towards the dimming stars with a roar of complete rage.**

� What sort of SICK joke is THIS?!!�

** He had been steaming over this ever since he had merged with this 
transmehal 2 body, ever since he had returned.
He had lied to himself over and over again that it was great to be alive 
again, when all he really wanted was to simply rest in peace!
He hadn�t returned to Earth willingly, even though he had never reached the 
Matrix.
Something had drove him back against his will, and now he was here fighting 
the same slaging war that he had helped create.
It wasn�t fair!
Dinobots silver fangs gleamed in the dying star and moonlight, his sides 
heaving in the deep breaths he took.
His rage was rising again, and thus his pulse was speeding up.**

� You brought me back here! WHY?!!!�

** He was hoping that the Matrix, the very thing that he was question to 
find, would hear his roars of rage.
Not caring if a bot in this world thought he was crazy for speaking to the 
sky, though he knew for a fact that it heard him.
Even though he didn�t know it, maybe the reason that he was always so 
injured after battles was because he was secretly hoping that he would die 
again.
But it wouldn�t even be half as honorable as his past death, the very death 
that was supposed to grant him into the Matrix.
But even as he glared into the heavens, there was no answer.
Simply silence�and the light flaps of a dragons wings.
Dinobot growled sharply and bowed his head, his clawed hands digging into 
their fists. Mech-fluid spilling and splattering onto the scales of 
Necromancer.
His silver face completely shrouded in shadow, only the red slits of his 
eyes visible.
It wasn�t fair!
And he was the one paying for it!**
